WRITING.TITLE: Samsung pay on non samsung device
WRITING.TEXT: Is there any way that i could use the samsung pay feature on my oneplus 6.
App doesn't show in play store. If I download the apk, it doesnt work.
It doesn't seem to be working at all.
Ohh. I hope they do. Thanks :)

WRITING.TITLE: Full Screen Support for Oneplus 6
WRITING.TEXT: I have been playing this game for about 3 years now. About a year ago when i switched to my Oneplus 6, i noticed that the game doesnt play on full screen. The screen is cut from top and bottom as if i still have huge bezels. Its been so long, so many updates, yet this issue is not resolved. What to do?

Hi. First of all, Congratulations on your new Device. I'm an OP6 user since the day it came out so i'll try my best to help you. First things first, invest in a good case and tempered glass for the phone. This is a glass sandwich, and you dont want it cracking. Secondly, to answer your first question, the latest version of the OS is pretty perfect as far as i've noticed. Recently i was encountering a few bugs, but this update seemed to fix all of them, and the so called battery issue, I've not experienced it yet. As far as Gcam is concerned, the latest version of that works pefectly. I didnt use much of the features. I tried normal pictures, portraits and night mode. All of which seemed to work perfectly. You can just search for the app on XDA forums. As far as recommended apps go, i'll say its a matter of preference and need. I usually set up my home screen in the stock launcher, switch to google photos instead of stock gallery and thats about it. However if you need an app for great wallpapers i'll recommend Creative and Wallpixel. I've been using this phone for a year, and its a beauty. I hope you enjoy your new device. Feel free to ask any more questions :)
True that
Yeah. You'd think you have a great image. But you zoom in and voila, its fucked.
You definetely should. Battery life is just as good if not better.
S10e is pretty decent. I thought about going for S10 as well. However, the name SAMSUNG, sends down chills down my spine. The way their phones age sucks.
YT music is a relatively new app. The developer of the icon pack will update the app with icons for those as well. In the meantime if you wish, you can send them a mail requesting the icons as well.

Hi, I Am from India as well and i have owned a oneplus 6 ever since it came out last may. My phone is still in perfect condition, it doesnt slow down, there are no lags or any issues. however i'd recommend before buying your friends phone, you might wanna check it first. Use it for 10-15 mins, put it to intensive tasks, pubg +snapchat+ facebook+ whatsapp. Ideally, my phone doesnt slow down when all that is open, neither does it load the apps again. So that is what you want to look for. If it works perfectly, then you have a good deal. In my opinion OP6 was their perfect phone yet. I'm gonna be switching to OP7, just because of the snapdragon 855. Hope it turns out to be worth it.
Yeah. Even brands like Oppo and VIVO seem to take better pictures. Of course, not to mention the kings of photography, Pixel and Huawei

Well I'm more of a picture person. So haven't really tried the video part. I'll take your word for it. But i forgive the OP6 for its camera because it delivers great performance for the money. I barely use the camera anyways.

Honestly it depends upon how the person has used it over the course of the year. Some people have weird charge cycles where they will either charge the phone every time the battery drops by a few points ot they will wait for it to discharge completely. Both of which harm the battery life. But if he has maintained it nicely, i'd say it'd be at 90% of its efficiency easily, maybe even better You can go to the battery stats, and check thr screen on time, and usage details. That should give you an idea.

Gcam is good, but it cant replace the stock camera as it isnt stable right now. As for the case thing, spigen will do a good job. I'm pretty sure all your other issues will be resolved once the phone arrives.
If it was connected to your samsung account, you can just login to that account and restore everything.
Have you encountered any major bugs? Also what kernel are you using with Havoc OS

[https://www.reddit.com/r/OnePlus6/comments/big7gc/so\_i\_installed\_havoc\_os\_and\_its\_better\_than/](https://www.reddit.com/r/OnePlus6/comments/big7gc/so_i_installed_havoc_os_and_its_better_than/) You might wanna take a look at this one as well.
Cool. I'm looking forward to trying it as well. Can you post some screenshots?
Cool. Thanks
Lemme know if you do try havoc os. I've been looking forward to trying it myself. Not sure what to do cuz I'll be switching to OP7/PRO as soon as it comes out
Ohh. Cool. But if you want something reliable shouldn't you just head back to OOS
Yeah. Dont worry :)
What about oneplus 6?
Oneplus 6 has blank edges at the top and the bottom. https://photos.app.goo.gl/sArMy1bE9Rhz82HY9

I dont mind unlocking bootloader for it. I unlocked it previously, used few roms. Nothing felt good enough so locked it back So about the rom, you encountered any issues? And did you flash any kernel?

Cool. Will do
Same here. I like amoled wallpapers, but this shitty thing
Sure.

WRITING.TITLE: One of the best decks I've ever used.

WRITING.TEXT: Yeah. I come across decks with lvl 13 pekka a lot of times. Once you get used to this deck, you can take out pekka easily. A combo of electro and mega minion, or prince and mega minion or electro and prince does the job easily.
This has helped me push from 4200 to 5300.

Well tbh its gonna be a great switch to OnePlus. You'll be experiencing new things such as the dash charge. The Oxygen Os is just as great as the stock experience on Pixel, but a bit better. Put that along with timely updates, you get an amazing thing. Yeah you're gonna miss the camera on pixel. The OP7 camera is going to be great, no doubt. Definitely better than pixel 2Xl. However not the best in the industry. Its decent if you take pictures now and then, but if you are deeply into photography, you might not like it. Apart from this i can't think of one reason why you shouldn't switch.

You'll have to wait a month or so to find out about those issues. I'll be switching to OP7 soon enough. Probably 1-2 days after it is announced, on the first sale event. I'll update you about the issues if i find any
It will be on sale on amazon for prime members starting about 2-3 days from the announcement and about a week later for rest of the world
Yeah. In India, we get 1 day shipping with amazon prime, so that adds to the sweetness of the deal.
There is no official source but that has been the pattern for oneplus sales for the past 4 devices. Amazon has already started pre bookings for the same as well.
This could change this year as OP7 is their biggest device yet, and they specificaly mentioned they are targetting US this time. So fingers crossed.
In process with that
Cool. We have that feature, but its still in beta phase.
I've never heard of any fix. Can you tell me?
This seems like a pretty well made deck. What seems to be the issue?
Oh yeah. That does seem to he true.
Nopes. Not working
I tried, but it made no difference.

Look for the performance, try to run multiple apps, check the battery stats, the camera, check for the edges of touchscreen, to see if they work or not. Spend like 10 mins using the phone to check everything perfectly. Also what part of the world are you from?
Delhi?
I have the same issue with airtel. Cant seem to find a way
I ask because i am gonna switch to OP7 pro as well. If you're interested you could buy mine. After testing, of course.

Hi there, I've had my oneplus 6 for almost a year now and the few tips that I'll give you are. Never use a cheap cable with the original charger. Try not to leave your phone on charging at night, with this speed why would you need that anyways. Always keep a cover or skin on the phone, its damn slippery. Apart from that use the phone any way you intend to. Its a beast. Also, Congratulations

If you are choosing between the 6 and the 6t. I'd definitely recommend the 6 over the t model First of all you get the so beloved headphone jack Secondly you can get it for a cheaper price. Thirdly you have that amazing fingerprint sensor. Yeah you do get the notch, but then you also get the led indicator and how much can the notch really bother you anyways. I've had OP6 for a year, and honestly. I dont mind the notch anymore.
I doubt how it'd do.
Thats true.
On my Op6, that issue seems to be gone.
I took it to oneplus service center. They took 15 mins, formatted my phone and reloaded the software i guess. Ever since then it has been perfect.
You're one of those log bait players. Ehh
Lol. I've beaten decks like yours a thousand times. I'm 5000+ And with a self made deck, not the one everyone is copying.
Sure bro. Whatever makes you happy at night. Look me up #VC8C9RYP Thats my player tag. Challenge me with your so "original" log bait deck. We'll see how you do.

This is one of the most common debates at this moment. Now considering you are looking at the 12gb model of 7pro, price definitely isnt the factor here, so I'm gonna move past that. Moving on the camera, there are various videos out there comparing the camera of s10+ , huawei p30 pro and oneplus 7pro. You can watch them if you like, but in short the 7pro gives competition to the p30 pro, if not outdoes it at points. And p30 pro is the camera king at the moment, so thats saying something. Secondly, softwares. Samsung has never been known for fluid softwares. Even though one ui is good, its no oxygen os. And moreover the system updates. Oneplus is the fastest to give updates, after google of course. Moving on, yeah the motor camera isnt that great. But atleast you get the whole screen to yourself and how many times are you gonna use the front camera anyways. OnePlus phones age the best in the market, even better than pixel phones. And Samsung ages rather shittily. You do get reverse wireless charging and an ip rating. But here you get the 30w warp charger. And the ufs 3.0. it's a lot faster than any other phone using ufs 2.1. These are my opinions, the reasons why i am choosing the 7pro over the s10+ The nebula blue color that I'm getting is just a cherry on the top.
Lol. Pretty sure i have a better life than you. So do whatever you want to. I aint wasting time on a crybaby no more.
Oh yeah. Of course, the most important selling factor to the phone.

Hi. Oneplus 6 user here. I have the same pattern, switching phones once a year. I skipped the 6t because of the fingerprint and the lack of headphone jack. However the headphone jack is dead now, almost everywhere. And with the reviews of 7pro saying its fingerprint sensor is amazing. If you ask me, i'd say that if you have the money, go for it. Its definitely an upgrade. Its their best and most complete phone till now. And i dont see why not, apart from the money problem, if you have that.

I'm facing the same issue. So here's my recommendation. Skip the grey. You've always used black/white. The blue on the 7pro is amazing. It's matte and its one of the prettiest colors on a phone I've seen. The almost color is good though, although not my cup of tea. I'd stills say its a nice color. So it comes down to if you are okay with that gold-ish finish. I'm going for the blue variant because i cant bear that gold finish. And also cuz that blue is amazing.

You mind sharing some images of your phone with us? I'm on a op6 right now, and i am planning to move on to the 7pro.. Some images and a bit more of your feedback on the phone would be really appreciated.
Thanks man.

Idk whats the obsession with ip rating. It does nothing apart than giving you a peace of mind. You do know that even the ip rated phones, if suffer water damage and not considered under warranty by the companies.
I've used samsung, apple, even nexus phones. And trust me, nothing ages as good as a oneplus device. Go for the 7pro, you wont regret it.
Get a new pair of hands maybe. #128514; If size is an issue, maybe look at op7 and not the pro model.
I'm sure you will.
Exactly.
It does. But its pretty different under the hood. Its almost as good as the 7 pro. ALMOST. You can buy ihands or something #128514;
Lol. I got words, but not the time for someone like you. I'll be happy to hand you your ass if you want to clash in the game tho.
Apple does age good, but it doesn't compare to how well a oneplus device ages.
Which color did you go for?
Oh nice. Could you share some pictures. Also how does it look with a case? Thats what worries me most.
Share a picture with the nylon case please.
Oh man. That is a beauty. Thanks for the pics #128525; #128525; #128525;
Nah man. You cleared the only doubt i had. Now I'm just waiting for them to launch the blue color in my country on 28th.
I mean android updates. Security patches do get a bit delayed at times in oneplus, but android updates do get delivered with a lightning fast speed.
There is no perfect phone. You got to choose the one that suits you most. I prefer android updates over security patches. So i go for oneplus.

WRITING.TITLE: OnePlus 7 mirror grey or nebula blue
WRITING.TEXT: So I'm planning to buy a oneplus 7 pro. I'm confused between the nebula blue version and the mirror grey version. The confusion exists that blue is a different color and is pretty cool, but how much does color matter if I'm gonna strap on a case to it anyways. Also if i guy mirror grey rn, i get OnePlus c type earphone free along with some other goodies. Please help me out , also some pics of both the devices will be much appreciated. Update: Guys i went for the mirror grey version as i got approx 100$+ worth of goodies with the phone.
Try simple digital watchface. It has all these features and looks pretty dope and clean
I did hear that the OnePlus devices sold on t-mobile dont come with the screen guard
Cool. Thanks

Over here there's a popup experience event going on. I got the free goodies over there along with approx 20$ extra discount on the main amount. The nebula is a great color, but there's the issue of compatibility with cases. Not all cases would look nice would the blue color. The grey color is nice, the mirror black was the most appealing part to me. I currently have the op6 mirror black, and that grey still seemed lovely and appealing. I guess it would come down a lot to your personal preference, and the phone you are currently using. But yeah, if you want a phone that stands out from the rest and would like to rock a transparent case, go for the blue version. But if you are like me and would use a protective case, go for the black version.
Nah, nothing like that. You might want to take a look at your proximity sensor. If that is blocked that might be the problem, or maybe the screen guard you are using.
Nah the case isnt. Something on the screen must be bothering the sensor. Do you face any issues like screen turning off while taking calls as well?
That is supposed to happen by design. Check your proximity sensor once, if that doesn't work try reinstalling WhatsApp. Otherwise you need to take it to a service center.
Must be.
Well coming from a OP6, it still does feel a bit big. Its like Samsung Note territory. But being big isn't the issue, the issue is that it's bulky

WRITING.TITLE: Issue using Samsung gear S3 with OP7 PRO
WRITING.TEXT: I recently got my OP7 pro and i have been using it with my Samsung gear s3, which i used previously with my OP6. However now I'm facing an issue that whenever i pick up a call, it is automatically directed towards the speaker. What's even weirder is that on the phone it doesn't show speaker mode. Any solutions?
But then would i be able to take calls on my watch?
Yeah. Probably. Will try to find something
Looks dope. I'm just worried about it falling and shattering. Also, can you show the tempered glass or screen protector that you're using?
Icon pack?
And also a link for the wallpaper. They both look amazing.
Thanks man.

WRITING.TITLE: Tempered glass for OnePlus 7 pro
WRITING.TEXT: I've been trying to search for tempered glass for my phone. The flimsy screen guard that comes with the phone had bubbles in it and i had to remove it. After that I've tried 3 different tempered glass and each has the same issue, that there is glue just at the edges and so the screen doesn't work properly. Has anyone found a perfect tempered glass for the phone? Please share some pictures and link for the same if you have. Update: I wasnt able to find anything online so i went to the market and found a tempered glass. The shopkeeper quoted a price of 25$. I bargained it down to 15$. Its one of those uv tempered glass where they put the glue on the screen then apply the tempered and then do something with uv to set it. However it works amazingly, no issues with screen or fingerprint at all. Also this is the only one so far that has worked. It seems to be case compatible as well, using it with the official carbon fiber case right now
Can you share a picture and the link for the screen protector?
Alright thanks.
Found the same thing from a market. Did the guy who apply it for you use some glue on the screen before applying the tempered glass?
Oh. So howz your glass coming along so far? Any issues? And how much did it cost you?
Oh. I got a good deal then. And yeah it was completely clean upon application
It wont be coming bruh. Leave hope for that.

I have the same issue. If i am in a dark room or try to pick up the phone while listening to a voice note, the screen goes completely dark. It definetely has something to do with the sensor. Maybe its just too sensitive?
I go with the basic settings. The one's that come pre-set. They seem good enough to me.
I guess when the Bluetooth is connected the audio is auto routed to that and sensor doesn't get the primary preference. But yeah this issue is mainly seen in whatsapp.

WRITING.TITLE: Should i buy the Oneplus 7 pro Sandstone cover
WRITING.TEXT: I love the official oneplus cases, and have already gotten myself the nylon and carbon case. I'm not sure about the sandstone cover though. I had all the official cases for oneplus 6 and that was the only one that got broken, so idk if i should go for it again or not. Anyone here have any experience or opinions about the sandstone case? Please feel free to share
Cool. Share some pics once you get it. My fav so far is the nylon bumper.
I have the official carbon case. That's pretty nice and durable. It was my fav when i had the OnePlus 6
True. The curve seems to be the biggest fear right now.

I've seen both the phones and the red is one of the most beautiful phones right now. I'm using a 7 pro, mirror grey and dont get me wrong. The grey color is amazing as well, but if the 7pro had a red option, i wouldn't even think twice before getting it.
No the battety saver is supposed to turn of the haptics in order to preserve the battery.

Use it and then find out. I've been using my 7pro for a week and it definitely gets better. I use my right thumb more and therefore it recognises the right thumb faster now, compared to the less used left thumb

Oh. Idk i have always noticed that the battery saver seems to kill the haptic feedback if not minimise it. Although its been a long while since i used the battery saver so they might have changed that.
Oh. I read that wrong. Lol, my bad.
Nah it isnt too big. Especially on day to day usage, you wont ever feel that.

I had the same question a few days ago, and i chose to go with the bullets wireless 2. First of all you get usb type c for charging, so one less cable to worry about You get amazing battery life and even better charging speed. You get clear sound, with great bass (not the best, but great) Comfortable fit, compared to all the options i tried Bluetooth 5.0 for a better connection. The sound and battery were the major deciding factors for me.
See my answer above. It might help you :)

It's definetely the best I've tried. The alignment is perfect that it comes really close to your mouth, therefore the audio is loud and clear. There is no disturbance or break in mic audio, which i experienced previously with my Skullcandy earphones.
Wtf were you doing with 800+gb of data

Ringke fusion if you want bulky protection OnePlus nylon bumper case for minimal protection with grip Oneplus sandstone cover for that sleek yet grippy look And oneplus karbon protective case, for a protective yet slim look, but not that grippy. There's also nilkin, if that's available in your country. Its frosted cover feels as slim as applying a skin on your phone.
Makes you wonder where that 800gb data went
Guess so
I dont have the galaxy watch, but i have the gear s3. And everything works amazingly, except for Samsung pay of course.
Looks dope. Icon pack?
Thats quite cheap. Any clue about the front display price?
I'm interested in that as well.
Thanks man.
Icon pack?
Cool. Thanks man.

Yep. I have 2 oneplus 7 pro. One updated through ota and other through oxygen updater. Both work equally well

The feel is amazing and premium. Adds a bit of size though, but definitely worth it considering the protection. I would recommend going for the black color instead of the blue/red as it's the best looking out of the lot.
Yeah. Thats pretty nice as well.

Idk. So far none of the drops that i had seemed to break my phone.

I dont think so. Looks like an unnecessary gimmic. Even the mclaren edition isn't worth it. last time they had something good for the mclaren. I was expecting maybe a 50w charger or 120hz display for the mclaren edition, but nothing.

Hey. I see all those negative reviews and would give you my opinion, being a college student. Go for OnePlus, i swear by it. Its an amazing phone, especially for students. Youtube- full qhd screen done Games- 90hz done Assignments- 6.7inch screen done Getting late and no battery- warp charge done Storage- no issues Slowdown- never Being a college student i dont think there's a better option in this price range. The camera isn't like mind blowing but i promise you, its no low res either. It gives off great shots. Also the price drop could be somewhere around 100-150$ i'd say. There's no telling that. But expect more drop on 7pro than 7t/t pro

WRITING.TITLE: Should i switch my Oneplus 7 Pro for Oneplus 8 pro
WRITING.TEXT: I live in India and have been using my OnePlus 7 pro for almost a year. I was amongst the first people to get my hands on the phone and i have loved it for a year. During the launch event when the prices were revealed i was shocked to see the 8pro being 899$. However today when Indian pricing was revealed it's around 720$. Which is 25$ more than what i paid for my 7pro at that time. This leads to me the question is it worth switching now? I like the specs on the 8pro, the Snapdragon 865, the 120hz screen, the improved cameras. They're all great. BUT, there's that holepunch. There's the issue of a bigger size (i dont want the 8, it lacks a lot). So should i upgrade or stick with this till maybe the 8t pro or 9pro arrives? EDIT- Thank you everyone for your responses. I'm going to stick with my 7pro for the next 6 months atleast, lets see what the T model brings.
I agree. Plus I'm kinda hoping OnePlus comes up with a smaller phone in the future. 6.78" seems too big already feel 7pro is big n heavy
Nah. No 5G Wont be getting it for the next 2-3 years either.
That is a nice way to put it. Thanks for the advice
Very truly put. Thanks for your advice.
True. The punchole sucks. The moment i saw the punchole, i was like, "Do i really wanna go back in time with my next phone? "
It's still a trade off
Money is the most important factor and while it's appealing to get the 8pro, the phone didn't convince me completely to buy it. So I'm just gonna skip
Icon pack?
A tempered glass would make the world of a difference for you. Go for one of those UV tempered glass

WRITING.TITLE: Haptic feedback in gaming mode not working
WRITING.TEXT: When the OP7 PRO came out, OnePlus boasted about their haptic feedback in gaming mode. You'd get these little vibrations while shooting in pubg, gave you an extra touch. However, the same doesn't seem to work anymore. Its been a long while since it worked. I've tried formatting the phone, even clean installing oos again. Any solutions?

WRITING.TITLE: 7PRO getting really laggy (anyone else)
WRITING.TEXT: Its been about a month since I've been noticing my phone slow down. First of all there's the issue that if u restart your phone, you got to press the power button twice for your screen to turn on, the only workaround to which is switching the screen to 1080p. Even moving away from that thing, recently I've been feeling my phone is a lot slow. It's the basic things, I'm using one app, get notification from another, i click on it, and earlier the transition used to be instant, but now it takes like 5 seconds to move from one app to another. At times when i use the swipe back gesure, the white indicator that comes when u swipe back, it stays there until i tap the screen again, sometimes even longer. And the last one is when I'm using my keyboard to type and i swipe back to put the keyboard down, the weird arrow looking icon gets stuck there sometimes for 5-10 seconds making that area non responsive. 7pro has Snapdragon 855, which is by no means a slow processor. OnePlus phones were supposed to be fast and smooth, this is not smooth. I asked around with my friends who have OP7pro, they have been facing similar issues. Anyone know how to fix it? I tried formatting and clean flashing OOS.

I agree. I always used to be so proud of my OP devices, showing off the performance, no lag and all that. Taking a crack at Samsung for being laggy and it seems like OP is indeed becoming the very thing it set out to destroy
Man this setup looks dope
Anyone know how to do this?
That looks dope man. You have some tutorial or something for this?
Thanks man. Got my exams going on right now. So probably gonna wait a week to do it.
Lucky you
Hi I have the same model with me. Can you tell me how much amount of ram you're getting. Mine says 8gb ram, but I'm getting 5.9 gb as 2gb shows up as hardware reserved. Do you have the same issue?
Bro, where are you getting it for 65000. I just got one 3 days ago for 75000
Go for the recently launched mi laptops or the asus Zenbook series
I got it from a hp store. 75k for thr freaking laptop and a laptop bag. Thats it.
Oh. There's no way to get that memory back? It just seems awful to be paying so much for a laptop with 6gb ram.

I have not faced any issues so far, and yeah the smoldered part is a shit deal. Wish i had done my reaearch more properly before buying this. Also the 2gb is reserved at all times, and is in no way usable.
How'd you flash the rom?
Same thing happened to me few days back. Took me a while too. I thought i got lucky, but seems like this is the new normal procedure.
Why not just install a custom rom though?
Thanks man. Can you do one more with everything black and outlines white?
Happy cake day
Happy cake day

WRITING.TITLE: OnePlus buds or Samsung Buds +
WRITING.TEXT: I'm planning to buy truly wireless earbuds for myself. I was planning to buy the Oneplus buds when they come out, but today i got a mail from Samsung stating that they are available for 8500 INR. To put that into perspective, OnePlus Buds will cost 4990 INR, So thats about half those of buds+. I've however heard great things about the buds+. I'm not a huge music lover, my general tasks are video calls, music every now and then, Netflix and such, gaming. What should i do, should i wait for the buds or go for samsung?
Oh damn. Well i can't wait for a year or half a year, So will probably go for buds+ then Thanks man
Yes please. Samsung has them on offer in my region. It'll be great to get a real feedback from someone, who's not getting paid from the reviews.
Sure
How in the world do you already have OnePlus buds?
Buds+ definitely sound way more appealing. Thank you
Yeah. That sounds fancy
Hadn't considered that. Thanks man
Oh, well that sucks. Calling was one of the primary purposes
Sucks for me too, but not exactly a deal breaker for me. Still considering em
Alright man, thanks for the advise.
Oh thats cool. I liked the airpods as well so dont think that in-ear seal is gonna be a deal breaker for me. Which color did you get?
Thanks man

Yeah money is a factor, especially considering that i wont be using them as much as a lot of people do. It's basically something to satisfy my inner self. It's just one of those impluse buys that i want a truly wireless earphones
Oh man That is truly appealing. Let me go and check the availability on those.
Hey man, Thanks for the review. Can you share some pictures of the blue version, if you have em
Haha. Cool Mind sharing few pictures?
Oh man That's some detailed info right there. However i do appreciate you putting in so much effort. Can you also tell a bit about latency playing any games, if you do play anything.
Thanks man
I dont think they're available in India
Yeah. Just checked, pixel 4 and buds are not available in India. Sucks
That seems to be the general advice. You know any buds with good ANC?
Active noise cancellation. Like the type you find on airpods pro or bose quite comfort.
Yeah that's the only thing stopping me from going for buds+ If I'm gonna spend that much, might as well spend few more bucks and get something with ANC
It comes handy when studying for exams in a shared hostel room
Yeah can't see em at the price today either. I got a mail yesterday. But now the price is changed
Yeah probably
Hey. I have the same laptop and looking to get the same thing Mind telling me how you placed the order?
Any contact details?

Damn man. That must suck for you On the same note I've been talking to some people who've had the oneplus buds for a while now and if you're considering going for airpods, might as well go for the buds. They're fairy good. Also thanks for the update. Appreciate it
Haha. I dont pity you, and yeah they're always returnable, but its the experience that matters. So you're going with airpods?

Yeah i dont think you'll be able to modify the controls, but thats gonna be the case with airpods as well. I had the airpods and the lack of ability to see battery Without a 3rd party app, the fact that i cant customise controls and it always preferring an applr device over android drove me away.
So many foxes. I feel foxy
Nah, you're right on point. Android has a way around everything, i just didnt find it that convinient. But airpods were great, the sound was amazing, calls were clear and the connection was stable

Well yeah 1) battery stats aren't there, even the 3rd party apps arent accurate 2) it'll always prioritise an apple device over android 3) the connection is good, but not as good as it is when it's connected to a iphone
Yeah. Just waiting for them to be available for purchase
Flash sale on 31st and open sales on 4th
Wallpaper?
Congratulations man I'm waiting for them to go on sale
The offer is live again on Samsung's website right now
Check the website of samsung. they're on offer again

I've already ordered the blue ones as well. Will be arriving in a day or 2
It's not only the man standing by his words tho

I just thought it was lying there.

I still have the OPBW2. The sound quality is better than those. I like the fit of the buds more, i couldn't get a good fit with the wireless 2 The audio is nice, good bass. Sound is clear. Calls are crystal clear, no background noise. Battery I've not tested yet. But will update you
Yeah. Flash sale was on 31st i guess. I got it in that sale. And yes there is a definete improvement in audio quality.
Haven't actually tested the battery life yet. Will get back to you on that
I opened them at 70% Used them for 2 hours Got down to 50 So you can get 6 hours easily This was at 90% volume btw

Great review man. Completely agree. But i believe that the op buds fit is a hit and miss Do you mind helping me by creating a video of how you put the op buds in your ears? I'm afraid I'm doing something wrong because in 1-1.5 hours of usage my ears start to pain
Damn. Yes i can
Yet people give the phone so much shit for the camera
I dont mind it tbh. My photos come out pretty great
*have been
Sure its just the butter that's smooth?
It's amazing Definete upgrade over season 1

Season 1 isn't too bad, but yeah if you wanna watch a 10min recap of season 1 before starting season 2, you wouldn't be missing out on much either. To me season 1 felt like 50% of it was a big filler episode for the rest of the episodes and for season 2.
Battery life imo is much better than airpods. 1 week easy battery life. Approx 6 hours without the case And 27-30 hours with case Charging 0-100 in 50-57 mins

Can't say about that. I've had them for 12 days now and have charged them just once And still have about 60% juice in my case And i love them. For me the fit is amazing as well I do hope you get your hands on em soon.
Amazing work man. I've always loved these type of videos and the amount of effort people like you put to give us these clips that just seem effortless is amazing Thank you
The pussy is finally healed up

WRITING.TITLE: Planning to change the ROM
WRITING.TEXT: I've been using OP7PRO for over a year. Lately, for about 3-4 months I've been experiencing major lags in the phone. Things that just dont work well, lags here and there, glitches and such. Oxygen OS is no longer as refined as it once was. I dont mind bloatware, but the one thing that kept me with Oneplus was the fact that it never lagged. I had a OP5, OP6 and they worked perfectly but recently Oneplus had gone offtrack So I'm planning to switch to a custom rom, but dont know what I dont know much about ROMS. I have heard about Havoc, Resurrection and Pixel experience. I'm also considering the possibility of rooting the phone on Oxygen os or moving to open beta. Can someone who is rooted/on open beta/ using a custom rom share their experience and recommend me what to do? P.S. Your time is much appreciated Edit: Thanks for all the comments. I'm going with Havoc Os.

WRITING.TITLE: Planning to change ROM
WRITING.TEXT: I've been using OP7PRO for over a year. Lately, for about 3-4 months I've been experiencing major lags in the phone. Things that just dont work well, lags here and there, glitches and such. Oxygen OS is no longer as refined as it once was. I dont mind bloatware, but the one thing that kept me with Oneplus was the fact that it never lagged. I had a OP5, OP6 and they worked perfectly but recently Oneplus had gone offtrack So I'm planning to switch to a custom rom, but dont know what I dont know much about ROMS. I have heard about Havoc, Resurrection and Pixel experience. I'm also considering the possibility of rooting the phone on Oxygen os or moving to open beta. Can someone who is rooted/on open beta/ using a custom rom share their experience and recommend me what to do? P.S. Your time is much appreciated

Thanks for the suggestions I've done factory reset 2-3 times. I even completely wiped off oos and reinstalled it once. The update 10.3.4 made the phone smooth for like 7-10 days, but its back to the old shit now Also I've heard the same about betas , have you ever tried them?
The chrome issues are very persistent. But from what I've gathered, that is more about the app as the issues seem to be on a lot of devices.
Many times. no use
I've been eyeing the pixel experience as well. Can you share for how long you've been using it, any bugs and some screenshots possibly.

Looks pretty decent to me 1) what's the battery life like? 2) any chance this rom has gaming mode and/or zen mode 3) are you rooted 4) do banking apps work fine? 5) do you prefer this rom over oos? Or do you feel like you'll go back
Personal experience with anyone?
I've heard a lot of good things about lineage as well. I'm majorly confused between lineage, resurrection and pixel experience
Thanks for the feedback. I'm down to pixel experience and lineage os. Will probably try pixel first
Thanks man In your preference what comes first Lineage or pixel experience, kinda confused between both.
Thanks
Hadn't considered havoc, but your review seems good. Does it have gaming mode like oos? Also did you try any other rom before havoc
Thanks man

I took a good look and it seems like I'm going with Havoc 3 more things 1) Does charging work fine? 2) which kernel do you use? 3) does the vol slider work okay? Also I'd also appreciate if you can recommend me some apps to use on the rooted device.

Oh man You went through so much effort to explain this to me. No encryption is not a deal breaker to me and i plan to flash gapps. Thanks for the recommendations for other apps though, will surely try them. Once again, thank you so much for your time and effort you put to help me. Appreciate it a lot
Oh man. Classes suck. I play a lot of pubg in my 3 hour classes :p

WRITING.TEXT: What?
Okay Got it Will update
Oh man, My alert slider wasn't going on silent for like 4-5 months. I've been meaning to visit a oneplus center for so long. I saw this post, gave it a shot and VOILA it works. Thanks man.
One hand to rule em all
Been 3 months, no leads

Op7 pro user here. I've rooted my phone like 10 times in the past 2-3 months to get a good idea of should i or should i not root it. 1) the rooting process is simple, just download all in one tool available from xda store. Enable oem unlocking and adb options in devp mode. Unlock bootloader and root it. All through the software 2) i tried bluespark, kirisakura and elemental ex kernel. Bluspark is the most stable out of all of them. Kirisakura is great but has a few bugs. 3) xxx nolimits is just amazing, makes your phone smoother than it ever was. 4) renovate ice, if available for your model. Make sure to install that. 5) substantrum theming is amazing. Makes your phone feel new and the options are amazing. 6) adaway is great. Almost no more ads on your phone. So why did i unroot? I'm not really sure either. I'm constantly switching between root and unroot. But yeah I'd definitely recommend to stick to oxygen os, because as good as the other custom roms are. The experience of oos is amazing. The gaming mode, zen mode, stock camera, 90fps on pubg, instant pairing with oneplus buds (if you have them). These are just some things that make you stick to oxygen os. Feel free to ask any questions if you have em.

There's a magisk hide module, apart from the one that came within magisk. It's named magisk hide or something. Use that, rename your magisk manager, hide magisk from cod. This won't happen again. https://forum.xda-developers.com/redmi-note-7-pro/how-to/pubg-crashing-fixed-rooted-phones-t4073331/amp/ This link can help
How do i get this

But what does matter is that i want to improve my gameplay. Help please.......

WRITING.TITLE: The most amazing six save I've ever seen

WRITING.TEXT: In cricket if the ball flies past the boundary line and lands on the ground, its 6 runs for the team. This guy leaped into the boundary zone, caught the ball, threw it out, before it landed on the ground saving his team 6 runs. The athleticism on this guy is just amazing.

Well that depends if they ran for some runs. There are no runs if the ball hits the ground before the boundary and you don't run. And yeah i mean diving for the ball is something, but this is just oooooooof
Haha. Terminology isn't important as long as we appreciate the skills
Hi. I have a similar problem. Will you be able to help me?
Thank you. I am looking for the rubber feet. I am unable to get a hold of them anywhere My laptop is Hp Envy x360 13 inch
Can't open it
Thanks man. Working now
https://forum.xda-developers.com/oneplus-7-pro/how-to/tool-tool-one-driversunlocktwrpfactory-t3930862/amp/ There you go
